articles.author: Rajat Mondal
articles.description:
This is a submission for the Postmark Challenge: Inbox Innovators.
ReplyAs - a modern shared inbox platform that transforms how teams handle email collaboration. üì¨ Instead of sharing passwords or forwarding emails, teams can now manage support emails together in real-time with complete transparency and control.
The solution addresses the common pain point of teams needing shared email access without compromising security üîê, making it perfect for customer support teams, shared department inboxes, or any collaborative email scenario. Teams can assign emails, add internal notes with @mentions, and track progress through a 5-stage workflow system (Todo ‚Üí In Progress ‚Üí Drafting Reply ‚Üí In Review ‚Üí Done). ‚úÖ





  
  
  üåê Live Application


Try it yourself: replyas.com
üìß Email: postmarktest@‚Ä¶
articles.title: Introducing Replyas: Shared Inbox, Simplified

articles.author: Carlos Almonte
articles.description:
In the software development world we write code on our individual computers and then our code has to be sort of uploaded into the main code the users actually run while using the app. Engineers write code on their computers and they create something called a ‚Äòpull request‚Äô (PR). A PR is a request from the Engineer who wrote the code to merge it into the main code. This PR is an opportunity for other engineers to review the code before it is merged. They can add comments to the PR so that the engineer who wrote the code can adjust it as requested.
PR comments that request for something to be changed usually hurt my feelings cause I‚Äôm too proud of the code I write. It‚Äôs like when writing an essay and getting an F instead of an A. It sucks. I‚Äôve been getting a lot of comments on my PRs lately. Wife and family have been helping me cope with this feeling.
articles.title: Coping With Receiving Comments on Your Pull Requests

articles.author: Emeruche Ikenna
articles.description:
In the labyrinthine world of search engine optimization (SEO), one term that frequently surfaces is "Domain Authority" (DA). This metric, developed by Moz, serves as a predictive score reflecting the likelihood of a website ranking high on search engine results pages (SERPs). A high Domain Authority can significantly enhance your website's visibility, credibility, and overall traffic. This article aims to demystify Domain Authority, explore its significance, and provide actionable strategies to enhance your DA score.
Domain Authority is a logarithmic score, ranging from 1 to 100, that estimates how well a domain will perform in search engine rankings. The higher the score, the greater the potential for a site to rank well. It is crucial to understand that DA is not a direct ranking factor ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Understanding Domain Authority: What It Is and How to Achieve a High Score

articles.author: Carlos Almonte
articles.description:
3 weeks off per year. I used all of it in this trip. My wife and I had planed this wedding for almost a year now. This wedding included 3 weeks long honeymoon in Italy. My wife was the planner and the head of this trip and I could not tell you enough how much of an amazing trip this was for me.
We had a budget already in mind and we were also surprised with wedding gifts in the form of cash. Not bad. That meant our trip budget was increased and therefore the fun and happiness were increased also.
I had tons of alcohol, mind you I was not a drinker not too long ago but went all in on this trip. Had a drink I discovered there called Limoncello Spritz, I might as well had an IV with Limoncello Spritz connected to my veins at some point.
Had tons of gelato. I entered a new era in my life where all I order is pistachio flavor ice cream. So good.
Did my religious activities. Attended mass in the church that is built on top of the very first Catholic Church ever ‚Äì St Peter Basilica. Beautiful. Just like many of the sightseeing in other areas.
I had a blast in my honeymoon In Italy. Discovered so many tasty and beautiful things. I mingled with someone from the opposite sex during a tour. We did not exchange a word or touch but we were in sync ‚Äì good vibes. Hope she does well in life. Many beautiful things in Italy.
articles.title: Honeymoon in Italy

articles.author: Sergei Solod
articles.description:
Hello everyone! Now I will tell you my story of failure. A year and a half ago, I, a JavaScript developer, decided to fulfill a long-standing dream - to create my own game. Not just a game, but a browser MMORPG. In January 2024, I dove into work head first and created an entire world in 10 days.
I was a scriptwriter, an artist, and a programmer. I did everything from scratch:
Plot and Dialogue: Wrote a story that can keep you engaged for hours.
Code: Full stack on Node.js, React and MongoDB.
Design: I drew and cut all the graphics myself.
UI/UX: Developed my own UI kit with custom buttons, windows and animations.
Mechanics: I thought out a combat system with magic and swords, quests and localization.
The result made me incredibly happy. The game turned out beautiful and alive. But creating‚Ä¶
articles.title: Only 30 Players in 18 Months ‚Äì Why My Online Game Failed?

articles.author: goker
articles.description:
Hey folks,
I just shipped a new Custom GPT called GypsyPT, built on top of an earlier hackathon project I called Prof. Warlock. That one answered emails with natal chart poster. This one? It speaks like a cosmic oracle.
It doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúgive results.‚Äù It invokes energies.

You give it your birth chart and today‚Äôs transit, and it responds like:
‚ÄúThe air tastes of iron. Venus weeps in shadow. Do not water the rosemary before noon.‚Äù
No casual AI tone, no raw aspect lists‚Äîjust full-on ritualistic storytelling. + It can generate a natal chart too!
You can try it here ‚Üí chatgpt.com/g/g-6845a7e7f1e48191908bb7306e6237fa-gypsypt

Full write-up ‚Üí goker.me/gypsypt
I‚Äôm thinking about adding tarot and dream journaling next. Maybe it  suggest some crystals for balance your energy! UP! UP! UP!
Would love to hear your thoughts‚Äîritual ideas, tone experiments, or strange prompts to try. Let‚Äôs open the veil a bit.
articles.title: üßô‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è New Custom GPT Dropped: GypsyPT ‚Äî a gypsy oracle

articles.author: Vin√≠cius Estevam
articles.description:
What is Cookie ?


In web context Cookies are objects that store user information to help identify, track, and personalize the user experience based on their actions on a website.
When you login in a website the server that process your request, if the login is successfuly, creates a cookie with an ID, user data and some informations such as the  cookie type, expiration time, refresh policy and so on. Once the brownser receive the cookie it becomes responsible to storing and send the cookie in every request to the server which will check the cookies properties on each request.
For this tutorial you will need to create a ASPNET CORE Web API and install the following packages:
<PackageReference Include="Microsoft.AspNetCore.Authentication.Cookies" Version="2.3.0" />
<PackageReference Include‚Ä¶
articles.title: ASP.NET 8 - Cookie Authentication

articles.description:
I'MMMM BACKKKK developers! My mystery project is underway! ...And it is literally just Monkeytype but it roasts you if you mess up.
What is SnarkyType?
üî• Features:
Roasts you for typing slowly ‚Äî and (totally) praises you if you're fast. But like... sarcastically.
Typing test for beginners‚Ä¶ but if you ignore the lessons? Prepare to be verbally suplexed. üíÄ
Games coming soon‚Ñ¢ that‚Äôll make you question your keyboard, your self-worth, and your decision to skip typing class in 6th grade.
Devs who are extremely online and will respond to your bug report at 2am with a meme and no context. Kind of like Andrew in Social Studies back in 1798.
ü§∑ Why choose SnarkyType?
SnarkyType turns learning to type into a game of roast roulette.
‚ÄúBold of you to attempt words with that level of skill.‚Äù
Or if you‚Äôre fast:
‚ÄúOkay showoff, we get it. You have fingers.‚Äù
üí™ Coming Soon:
Typing games like:
Speed Mode: Type fast or perish.
Chaos Mode: Words explode. Literally. (Probably.)
PvP Mode: Race against your friends or a bot named Chad with 200 WPM and no soul.
Public profiles and stats so you can shame your friends into practicing.
Achievements that celebrate weird milestones like ‚Äútyped 1000 words without crying.‚Äù
üß† Summary
Ready to type?
https://snarkytype-alpha.tiiny.site/

An alpha test of the typing test


  
  
  UPDATES COMING SOON!
articles.title: Introducing SnarkyType: The Snarkier way to type fast

articles.author: Serpent7776
articles.description:
LD_PRELOAD is an environment variable on Unix-like operating systems that allows users to specify a shared library to be loaded before others when a program is executed. This can be used to override functions in existing libraries or to inject custom code into applications. This functionality is provided by system dynamic linker and works only for dynamically linked executables. Statically linked binaries skip this entirely.
First, let's see what the dynamic linker is.
When a dynamically linked program is launched, before even calling the main function of the program a few things are done. One of the first things that the operating system does is that it reads the path of the dynamic linker from the executable image and then execute that as a program. This has to succeed or the whole progr‚Ä¶
articles.title: LD_PRELOAD explained

articles.author: bilel salem
articles.description:
Introduction: The JavaScript Runtime Evolution


The JavaScript runtime landscape has exploded with competition:
Node.js (2009): The established veteran
Deno (2018): Secure TypeScript-first runtime
Bun (2022): All-in-one speed demon
This 4,000+ word technical guide compares them across 6 critical dimensions with:
Reproducible benchmarks (HTTP servers, file ops, DB queries)
Architecture diagrams
Real-world migration examples
Decision frameworks for different use cases
1. Architectural Breakdown



  
  
  Node.js: The CommonJS Legacy



Key Characteristics:
CommonJS modules (require())
Callback-first non-blocking I/O
Massive npm registry (1.5M+ packages)
Deno: Secure TypeScript Runtime



Key Innovations:
Built-in TypeScript compiler
Secure-by-default (file/network permissions)
Web-standard‚Ä¶
articles.title: Deno vs Bun vs Node.js: The Ultimate Runtime Showdown
